intro: [WRONG START] Eugenia calchlorhoma, commonly known as the red-eyed ash or red-eyed tree, is a species of flowering plant in the Myrtaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Colombia, and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its small, glossy leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its fruit is a small, round berry that turns from green to red as it matures. The plant is often used in ornamental horticulture due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various growing conditions.
